section.name: What is Hippo ECM?
section.p: The Hippo Enterprise Content Management system is an application suite to use information efficiently. With Hippo ECM information can be: created, acquired, structured, managed, stored, preserved, shared, published on the internet, printed and searched. If desired, other applications can be integrated into the Hippo ECM application suite. Hippo ECM is targeted at medium to large organizations and can be used in many different ways. For examples of uses see Hippo ECM Use Cases. More about all the features of Hippo ECM can be found at Hippo ECM Features.

subsection.name: Why use Hippo ECM?
subsection.p: Managing all information in an organization is a daunting task. Knowledge is stored in numerous files, emails, webpages, forms, Excel sheets, and so on, and is handled differently for every organization. To work with all this information, every organization employs a diverse set of applications that adds logic and behaviour. Hippo ECM can integrate those applications, manage the underlaying information and present the end user with a simple, unified environment for all their information management.

ul.li:
Hippo ECM, 100% Open Source Enterprise Content Management:
Hippo ECM facilitates an open and flexible way of using your information by following internationally accepted open standards. This allows integration of other applications, ensures freedom to change to other ECM systems, if so desired

Extensively Modular:
Hippo EMC differentiates itself from other ECM and CMS systems by its clean separation of content storage, management and presentation. These modules (independent units) are even subdivided into smaller modules. This extensive modularity allows for fast development and for extensibility, even by other parties.
An overview of the higher level modules and their interconnection can be found at ECM Architecture.
